questions.question: I wanted to know why he …………………….. angry with me.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: I will write some letters if I ……………………… time.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the future tense, we use a present tense in the subordinate clause to refer to the future.

questions.question: There ……………………… an accident near the bridge.
questions.description: The present perfect is the most normal tense for giving news of recently finished events.

questions.question: I ………………………. six coffees since morning.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to say that something has happened several times up to the present.

questions.question: What ……………………… you do then?
questions.description: Then is a past time expression. We do not use the present perfect tense with past time expressions.

questions.question: ……………………………… to Australia?
questions.description: We use the present perfect when we are thinking of a period of time up to the present.

questions.question: They made him ……………………… them everything.
questions.description: The verb make is followed by object + infinitive without to.

questions.question: He …………………………… to visit the children once a week.
questions.description: We use a passive verb here because the subject is not the doer of the action.

questions.question: She ……………………….. a Greek goddess.
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about facts.

questions.question: It looks as if the sun ………………………… round the earth.
I used to play a lot of tennis when I ……………………….. younger.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: Three more of the missing hikers ………………………….
questions.description: The present perfect tense is the most normal tense for giving news of recent events.
